Vulnerability.Title: ibus-kkc bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The ibus-kkc packages contain the Japanese Kana Kanji input engine for Intelligent Input Bus (IBus). This update fixes the following bug: Previously, calling the XSetICFocus() and XUnsetICFocus() functions caused successive emission of the "update-property" D-Bus signal. As a consequence, changing input focus was noticeably slow and the GNOME shell used excessive CPU resources. A patch has been provided to fix this bug, and the delay in changing input focus no longer occurs in the described situation. (BZ#1096888) Users of ibus-kkc are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
